item.description:
We have decided to discontinue with Leibniz's Essay (we considered the Monadology just a detour form it) and move on to George Berkeley. We picked: Three Dialogues Between Hylas and Philonous in Opposition to Sceptics and Atheists. This is usually mentioned as one of his major works alongside with
A Treatise Concerning the Principles of Knowledge. We probably stay with Berkeley for no more than one meeting and then move on to David Hume and then will "touch on" the French enlightenment with de La Mettrie. Our near future goal is to get to Immanuel Kant (and hopefully to Hegel too).

Three Dialogues Between Hylas and Philonous in Opposition to Sceptics and Atheists is available on the internet, amongst others one of the web sites where one can find it is: http://www.bartleby.c...

Have a good reading and see you soon.
